Key Arguments: The legislation is an overreach of government power and infringes on free speech.
People have the right to express opinions based on their experiences.
The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' have been misused, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Many claims initially labeled as misinformation during the pandemic were later proven true.
The government and media have themselves spread misinformation.

As shown above opinions or so called 'facts' are not always correct and based on the information above people would have been in trouble for spreading misinformation or disinformation when in fact what they were saying was true and backed by evidence.
